Package colorguard

Class Colorguard

  • java.lang.Object
    • colorguard.Colorguard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Colorguard
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Colorguard class stores the state of the game and changes certain objects dynamically based on commands Colorguard stores the GameBoard, turns, and the state of a turn
    Author:
    amaytripathi
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Colorguard

        public Colorguard​(java.lang.String side)
        Initializes this Colorguard
        Parameters:
        side - the side of the player using this Colorguard

    • Method Detail

      • startGame

        public void startGame​()
        Starts the current game Sets currentTurn to "Blue" and totalTurns to 1

      • addPiece

        public void addPiece​(Location loc,
                     java.lang.String type)
        Adds a new Piece of specified type at given location
        Parameters:
        loc - the Location of the new Piece
        type - the type of the new Piece

      • addPiece

        public void addPiece​(Piece p)
        Adds given Piece to the board
        Parameters:
        p - the Piece to be added

      • getStartingPoints

        public java.util.HashSet<Location> getStartingPoints​()
        Gets all valid starting points for this game. A Location is a valid starting point if it is in the current player's starting zone and has no object on it currently.
        Returns:
        a HashSet containing all the possible starting points

      • getLandingSpots

        public java.util.HashSet<Location> getLandingSpots​()
        Gets all the possible landing spots for this game. A Location is a valid landing spot if it is a landing spot for the current turn and has no object on it currently.
        Returns:
        a HashSet containing all possible landing spots

      • getPossiblePieces

        public java.util.HashSet<Location> getPossiblePieces​()
        Gets all possible Piece selection locations for this game. A Location is a possible Piece spot if it contains a Piece on the current turn's side, has not been moved on this turn yet, and is not in jail.
        Returns:

      • getFlagHolder

        public Location getFlagHolder​()
        Gets the location of the flag holder for the current turn
        Returns:
        the Location of the flag holder, null if not any

      • getThrowOptions

        public java.util.HashSet<Location> getThrowOptions​()
        Gets all possible receivers of a flag after Throw Powerup is applied A receiver must be on the opposite starting zone and of the same side as the current turn
        Returns:
        a HashSet of possible throw options

      • getPossibleMovements

        public java.util.HashSet<Location> getPossibleMovements​(Location pieceLocation)
        Gets all possible movement locations for the Piece at given Location
        Parameters:
        pieceLocation - the location of the Piece to get the possible movements for
        Returns:
        a HashSet containing possible movements for Piece at pieceLocation

      • getPowerupAtIndex

        public Powerup getPowerupAtIndex​(int i)
        Gets the Powerup for the current turn at index i
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the powerup to get. 0 < i < 4 for a red turn and 4 < i < 8 for a blue turn.
        Returns:
        the Powerup at index i

      • getCurrentPowerups

        public java.util.LinkedList<Powerup> getCurrentPowerups​()
        Gets the Powerups of the current turn
        Returns:
        a LinkedList containing the Powerups for current turn

      • addNewPowerup

        public Powerup addNewPowerup​()
        Adds a new Powerup to the board. Calls nextPowerup to generate this Powerup randomly.
        Returns:
        the Powerup that was just added.

      • jailbreak

        public java.util.Queue<Piece> jailbreak​()
        Activates a jailbreak for the current turn
        Returns:
        a Queue containing all Pieces freed during this jail break

      • movePiece

        public java.lang.String movePiece​(Location pieceLocation,
                                  Location newLocation)
        Moves Piece and given location to the new Location. If a Piece existed at old Location, then sends that Piece to jail. If a Flag existed at old Location, then gives the Piece that flag. If a Powerup existed at old Location, adds the Powerup to the current turn's powerups.
        Parameters:
        pieceLocation - the Location of the Piece to move
        newLocation - the new Location of the Piece
        Returns:
        a String containing a description of what happened in the movement

      • getMovedPieces

        public java.util.LinkedList<Piece> getMovedPieces​()
        Returns:
        a LinkedList containing moved Pieces on the current turn

      • mySide

        public java.lang.String mySide​()
        Returns:
        the side of the player owning this game

      • setMySide

        public void setMySide​(java.lang.String s)
        Sets the side of the player owning this game to side passed
        Parameters:
        s - the new Side of the player owning this game

      • getBoard

        public GameBoard getBoard​()
        Returns:
        the GameBoard of this game

      • getCurrentTeamPieces

        public java.util.LinkedList<Piece> getCurrentTeamPieces​()
        Returns:
        a LinkedList containing the current turn's Pieces

      • pieceMoved

        public void pieceMoved​(Piece p)
        Adds given Piece to movedPieces
        Parameters:
        p - Piece to be added to movedPieces

      • isMoved

        public boolean isMoved​(Piece p)
        Tells if given Piece has been moved or not on this turn
        Parameters:
        p - Piece to check
        Returns:
        true if it has been moved, false if not

      • nextTurn

        public void nextTurn​()
        Updates this Colorguard to the next turn. Increments and updates turn values. Deactivates Powerups if needed, decrements all Powerups.

      • gameOver

        public boolean gameOver​()
        Tells if the current game is over or not. A game is over when a flag has reached the opposite starting zone.
        Returns:
        true if game is over, false if not

      • getTurns

        public int getTurns​()
        Returns:
        the current turn number of this game

      • getRedTurns

        public int getRedTurns​()
        Returns:
        the number of red turns that have passed

      • getBlueTurns

        public int getBlueTurns​()
        Returns:
        the number of blue turns that have passed

      • getCurrentTurn

        public java.lang.String getCurrentTurn​()
        Returns:
        a String representing the current turn ("Blue" or "Red")

      • getOpposingTurn

        public java.lang.String getOpposingTurn​()
        Returns:
        a String representing the opposite turn ("Blue" or "Red")

      • useSwapper

        public java.lang.String useSwapper​(Swapper swap,
                                   Location loc1,
                                   Location loc2)
        Uses the Swapper Powerup for Pieces at given Locations
        Parameters:
        swap - the Swapper Powerup to use
        loc1 - Location of Piece 1
        loc2 - Location of Piece 2
        Returns:
        a String describing the Swap

      • useClone

        public java.lang.String useClone​(Clone clone,
                                 Location pieceLocation,
                                 Location cloneLocation)
        Uses the Clone Powerup for Piece at pieceLocation and adds it as cloneLocation
        Parameters:
        clone - the Clone Powerup to use
        pieceLocation - Location of the Piece being cloned
        cloneLocation - Location of the Clone
        Returns:
        a String containing description of cloning

      • useHighWall

        public java.lang.String useHighWall​(HighWall highwall)
        Uses the HighWall Powerup on team opposite of current turn
        Parameters:
        highwall - the HighWall Powerup to use
        Returns:
        a a String containing description of action

      • useParalysis

        public java.lang.String useParalysis​(Paralysis paralysis,
                                     Location pieceLocation)
        Uses the Paralysis Powerup for enemies surrounding Piece at pieceLocation
        Parameters:
        paralysis - the Paralysis Powerup to use
        pieceLocation - the Location of the Piece to paralyze enemies around
        Returns:
        a String containing a description of all the Pieces paralyzed

      • useThrow

        public java.lang.String useThrow​(Throw powerup,
                                 Location oldLoc,
                                 Location newLoc)
        Uses the Throw Powerup, transferring Flag from Piece at old Location to Piece at new Location
        Parameters:
        powerup - the Throw Powerup to use
        oldLoc - Location of the Piece with the Flag currently
        newLoc - Location of the Piece that will be thrown the Flag
        Returns:
        a String containing description of the throw

      • usePowerup

        public java.lang.String usePowerup​(Powerup powerup,
                                   Location pieceLocation)
        Uses given Powerup on Piece at pieceLocation
        Parameters:
        powerup - the Powerup to use
        pieceLocation - Location of the Piece to use the Powerup on
        Returns:
        a String containing description of the Powerup application

      • nextPowerup

        public Powerup nextPowerup​()
        Generates a random Powerup at a random Location Each Powerup has a certain chance, many are different
        Returns:
        a randomly generated Powerup
